node.text: Cindy Rynning, award winning blogger, chats with Doug, the owner and creator of this gorgeous, soulful resort and winery. It’s a half hour of personable conversation and a quick tour of the resort.

node.text:
We’re bringing you beautiful Grenache Blanc wine tasting with Neil Collins co-owner + winemaker at @lonemadrone in the Adelaida AVA of Paso direct from his 1986 VW Wesfalia - what could be better while we S.I.P?
.
Neil’s many accolades include being named Wine Industry PERSON OF THE YEAR for the 2nd TIME! (Nearly as prestigious as making the Five-Timers Club on Sat Night Live).
.
Grenache Blanc delivers a great expression of the high lime content in the soils of Paso. On the nose it is bright + lively with subtle minerality showing the hints of anise that he relates to the soils. Notes of apples + pear skins are picked up alongside the characteristic Grenache Blanc tannin. On the palate is beautiful acidity + balance. The mouth feel has delicate structure, a pleasant wisp of salinity + a long finish. Mmmm.
.
Lone Madrone Special Online Deals! 😃🍷
1) 1 cent shipping with purchase of 6 or more bottles, when shipped UPS Ground in the continental USA. The discount will automatically be applied when you select UPS Ground. Not applicable to wine club shipments or ciders. 
2) Never before, now offering 10% off library wines!
3) Free delivery in SLO County - 3 bottle min purchase every Thurs
4) Curbside pickup at Bristols Cider House daily 3 – 6pm.

Lone Madrone Ships to these States:

AL, AZ, CA, CO, CT, FL, GA, ID, IL, IN, IA, KS, LA, ME, MA, MI, MN, MO, MT, NE, NV, NH, NJ, NM, NY, NC, OH, OR, PA, RI, SC, TN, TX, VA, WA, WI, WY, DC
.
Tonight, Thurs, April 30, Neil is coming to you live on Instagram at 6pm pacific time to unveil the 2nd video + their lovely Picpoul Blanc…a fave of mine. Find all of his videos on LoneMadrone.com.
.
Lone Madrone is a special winery to me as my boys grew up with his son, Jordan Collins (also featured in the video) in the Adelaida hood. Their many escapades included riding dirt bikes through the vineyards + playing soccer together. There were large pig roast get-togethers, poinsettia fund raisers, + possibly some sheep roundups…a lot of jolly fun + memories. How awesome that Jordan has banded together with his dad as an assistant winemaker! There is such talent + dedication to the highest quality + sustainability in the Collins family.

node.title: Shenanigans + Wine Tasting in the VW Westy

node.text:
This is a must-read story + a must-experience winery that crafts small lot, award-winning Rhône-inspired blends. The words, beautifully expressed by the owners Anita + Varinder, will surely get you excited to meet them + taste their premium wines at @copiavineyards - I for one, am hooked.

Let’s start w/ "Passionate curiosity started this journey. Tireless effort got us here. A sense of awe keeps us humble. Gratitude makes it real” KISMET (Fate or Destiny) Life's path is seldom straight. You move forward, then back, then side-to-side + somehow, forward again. For us, it all started in Chicago + Indianapolis, when hours of getting to know one another turned into yrs. There was a shy glass of Provençal rosé, which led to a serious Grand Cru from Burgundy, that then took us to an opulent line-up of wines from @BookerVineyard. And that was all in 2015! When we found ourselves in Paso at the end of that year, we looked at each other + said, "Now that's what's up." No matter what came before, or how it all unfolded, it was momentous. There can be a million reasons to not do something, but in the end, there only needs to be 1 powerful reason to move forward. It simply feels right. It's kismet. In 2015, we traveled to Paso + we have not looked back since. 

GRATITUDE
This could be a lucid dream, but the wine stains on our hands (+ 50 acres of paradise-on-earth in the Willow Creek District w/ breathtakingly beautiful slopes, calcareous soils + strong marine influence) make it all too real. Heartstrong + headstrong, we continue to leap into the future. We've got a few vintages + harvests under our belts + we couldn’t be more grateful for all the people who have helped us along the way. Family-Eric-Pete-Booker Vineyard-The Denner crew-The great people + wine community of Paso. We love you all. If this is a lucid dream...then we'll stay sleeping.
Thanks for sharing in our journey, Anita + Varinder

BONUS: Enjoy warm, 1st class hospitality at their NEW WINE LOUNGE addition to their elegantly modern, downtown tasting room. 

KUDOS: Jeb Dunnuck, on Copia's inaugural vintage: “-if these first releases are any indication, the future is very bright for this team.”

node.text:
Make a pact with your friends + go wine tasting with 1 caveat: Go to wineries that you have not yet explored because Paso is all about wine adventure + shaking things up (nothing stodgy here). Normally hit the west or eastside of Paso? Get creative + do the opposite.

GO COASTAL- @HarmonyCellars, located just a few miles from Paso Wine Country, is on the coast between Cambria + Cayucos. A fave getaway is driving on scenic Hwy 46 West (shown) to the quaint, artisan town of Harmony (population 18) off scenic Hwy 1. It’s one of the smallest towns in CA established in 1872 around a dairy that provided milk + cheese to folks in the area. As the only winery in town, Harmony Cellars tasting room has the advantage of being situated on the hill overlooking the tiny town with beautiful views of the pastoral, coastal countryside.

Kim + her hubby Chuck Mulligan, started the winery in 1989, no surprise, as wine runs thick in her blood. Her great-grandfather, Giacomo Barlogio, a founder of the old creamery cooperative, used to make wine in his basement - exactly what we expect from an Italian. 4 generations later, the winery sits on the family’s original landholdings. 

Chuck, crafts all of their wines in their redwood barn. He has a knack for crafting each varietal to highlight the individuality of the fruit + terroir of the land. 

WINNER: 2016 Cab Sauv - Awarded Gold + 95 points: CA State Fair; Gold: Central Coast Wine Competition; 91 points: Wine Enthusiast

This ‘Classic Cabernet’ offers intense aromas of cherry + licorice complemented by notes of soft oak. The palate is flooded with flavors of baked cherry pie, cassis + cola. The medium rich body, velvety tannins + well balanced, lead to a long, savory finish. 

EVENTS

Fri Twilight Concert Series: Summer 2021thru Sept 10, 2021, 5-7pm

Enjoy live music from the best local talent on their spacious patio every Fri night! Make your Reservations: $12/club, $15/reg.

Sunset Wine Dinners at Harmony Cellars
Wed, Aug 18th & Wed, Sept. 15th

Escape to Harmony for a 4 seasonal dinner courses prepared by Chef John McDevitt paired with Harmony wines served on their spacious, hilltop patio. Call for Reservations 805-927-1625.

node.text:
Crafting beauties, that is wine, is an easy task when food + wine pairing is totally steeped in your DNA. Meet the founder of @Donati.wine.spirits, Albino Donati, who migrated to the USA from the UNESCO World Heritage Centre, ancient town of Lucca with beautiful Renaissance walls circling it, located in Tuscany, Italy in 1907.

Add in a meal-stopper wines at Instagramable Donati in the tasting room + vineyard located on gorgeous Hwy 46 West on the cooler, westside of Paso.

Have you been to Lucca? It’s a foodie’s paradise that was originally built by the Etruscans + was then a Roman colony around 180 BC. During the Roman era, Lucca served as an important meeting place for Julius Caesar + Crassus. (If you make it to Lucca, make a rez at Buca di Sant’Antonio restaurant, open since 1782!)

Onward to the fun, show-stopper, meal-topper part of the Donati story…after all, grilling season is in full swing! 

When it comes to grilling the Paso way, don't forget the most important ingredient: A fruity, drinkable red wine that wows. Fire up your grill, but 1st grab this red wine from Donati, The Immigrant, which is 1 of their top tier family series named after founder, Albino Donati. It’s dark, dense fruit, layered with hints of oak + spice + are followed by a long, complex finish. Take 30% off the purchase of 6 or more bottles. Now we’re cooking (+ drinking) with fire!

Or if you consider yourself a serious Rosé drinker that needs to sip throughout the warm days of summer, you’ll want to grab a case or 2 of their crisp 2019 Rosé that was crafted from Cab Sauv free-run juice. With notes of strawberries + cherry limeade this is the perfect match for your summer fun. At ONLY $10 A BOTTLE, this is a MUST-HAVE WINE.

New in their lineup are SPIRITS. @Donati.wine.spirits on Hwy 46 West is hosting a fab Food Truck, + tastings, along with live music Sat, Aug 21 1-4pm as part of the SLO County Distillery Trail event. Plus there is bocci ball + HOUSE SPECIALS for you.

Let’s raise a glass to Albino’s talent + perseverance that created the footsteps that the family has been able follow for generations at Donati in Paso Robles! Cin, cin!!! (cheers in Italian)

node.text:
Calling peeps who are seeking a personal, more slow-paced wine tasting experience with real pros, whose goal is to create complex, well-balanced, memorable wines. @locatelliwinery is for you! "They don’t boast an expansive tasting room or parties every Fri, but what they can give you is a very personal wine experience involving their premium Estate wines", says California Winery Advisor. 

Being family owned + operated, you feel their hands on approach that starts in their estate vineyard, through the winemaking process + onto bottling. We are all pumped as this year they are celebrating their 20th anniversary of their craft, dedicated to producing the finest wines in the Paso Appellation! 

This is a must-visit winery especially for good doers as they donate a generous 25% of their proceeds from their “Old Mission” wines to the historic San Miguel Mission retrofit urgently needed to preserve this gorgeous Mission located a few minutes away…so close that you can hear the church bells every day at noon +  6pm at the winery. 

Their Old Mission San Miguel Arcangel is lovely blend of Cab Franc, Petite Sirah, + Petit Verdot mirroring the 3 knots the Franciscan Friars tie into their cintures (rope belt) symbolizing Poverty, Chastity + Obedience. This is a lovely fruit forward wine. Each sip is accompanied with black currant, dark berry medley flavors, velvety tannins + a long blackberry finish.

Their Old Mission San Miguel Arcangel Chard is perfect summertime sipping’ with freshly sliced Honeycrisp apple on the nose that is followed by baked Fuji apple + cinnamon, ripe peach, Mandarin orange, honeydew melon + a subtle lime zest on the finish. 

Not to be missed - their Cabs, Zins, Rosé + sweet dessert wines all which are sipped in the rustic wine barrel room with Instagram photo-perfect barrels backlit in electric blue, or on the patio with views of the valley + their 40 acres of vineyards. The vibrant vineyards consist of Cab Sauv, Merlot + Petite Sirah, Cab Franc, Malbec, Petit Verdot + Zin. It’s a treat to have access to many varietals as they serve as a kind of “spice cabinet” from which to select during the winemaking process. So cool, right? Cheers to cool!

node.text:
Psst. Enjoy dining on the patio in the vineyard with pretty views of the valley Summer/Fall on Saturdays + Sundays 11:30am-2:30pm @lonemadronewines with delectable, casual cuisine from talented Chef Jeff Scott @vineyardeventspaso - A fave locals’ hangout, because…well, you need to find out why for yourself.

HINT: Neil Collins won Wine Industry Person of the Year in 2015 + 2020…no surprise, he is a most highly regarded winemaker in Paso!

Lone Madrone's next summer supper bash is Saturday, July 31st. A few spots are available!  Savor locally sourced, gourmet cuisine paired to perfection with their handcrafted wines. Go to their website to make your reservation now!

At Lone Madrone, grapes are lovingly sourced from a handful of top sustainable vineyards located across the area (which means you're tasting the best of the entire region, responsibly all under one label).

As Neil Collins, the winemaker + co-owner says "The foundation of wine is farming. Farmers, rocks + dirt, graft + toil, sun + rain, frost + hail. These are the very things that are responsible in making a great wine great, period. At Lone Madrone, our focus is on singular vineyards farmed by equally singular humans. We prefer dry farming because it is the best expression of place, we prefer organic farming + we strive to allow our wines to honor the land from which they were born + to the people who tirelessly tend the vines.

Cheers to all the farmers, without you there would be nothing to cheers with."

When you sip Lone Madrone's distinct + varied, single varietals + blends you are experiencing the true taste of Paso terroir.

Oh + definitely try the winery's popular hard cider, an homage to Neil's upbringing in Bristol, England. An award-winning winery that also makes killer cider in Paso Robles? This is a wonder + unusual wonders are an everyday thing in Paso.

node.text:
You’ll be blown away by Brecon named “Winery of the Year”, with its ultra cool vibes that have made this a hands-down must-visit winery for serious wine lovers. Crazy…90+ awards from the top tier int’l wine review publications + competitions have been amassed by @breconestate.

This dog-friendly, boutique winery is the creation of an international award-winning winemaker, Damian Grindley + his wife, Amanda, who’re passionately devoted to the craft of producing a wide range of world class wines, along with “unusual blends.” (Photo Damien w/ Winston 🐾)

As fabulous as are their unusual blends, is their love story. It began while exploring a cave in Australia where these 2 avid international “cavers” first met. Damian, who hails from Wales, explored a cave under a vineyard. It sparked his fascination with soils + their effect on grape quality + ultimately the wine. Always curious, Damian has mastered vineyard management, which includes the oldest Cab Sauv vines in Paso.

Awaiting you are these beauties:

Best of Class. Platinum. 94 pts Monterey Int’l Wine Competition

2017 Brecon Cab Sauv/Petit Verdot: Best said by co-owner + winemaker Damian “When in barrel, the most apt descriptor I heard was- to quote a rather loud bonnie lass, “it’s a weee little beastie that”. Strangely that’s exactly what we strived for in a young bordeaux…with the underlying smoothness of 50% “ye olde vine” Brecon Cabernet + the opulent dark forest fruit from the Petit Verdot, we suspect this will meld into something remarkably long lived.”

Double Gold 95 pts Sunset Int’l Wine Competition

2020 Brecon Last Sandwich: So named as the winemaker + assistants hit upon the perfect aromatic Viognier + citrusy Albarino blend while devouring the last chicken tikka Panini (sandwich in Italian). Ironically it pairs remarkably well with spicier summer salads, sandwiches + paninis.

Double Gold Central Coast Wine Competition

2019 Haggis Basher (soon to be released!)

Buy at bit.ly/Brecon2 

You’ll swoon over their large wine bar that’s open to the scenic property via a sliding glass wall. Sip wine alfresco on the patio or at the picnic tables on the lush lawns. 

VIRTUALLY TOUR😃Text Brecon to 24587

node.text:
Found it! A wine lover’s paradise nestled in lush, fairy tale gardens dotted with 130 yr old olive trees on a jolly hilltop…ta-da, @stillwatersvineyards the Shangri-La of Paso.

You’ve got to meet the man behind this, owner Paul Hoover, who was selected as Winery Industry Person of the Yr in 2016 by his peers + who won 2019 Wine Grape Grower of the Yr at the Calif Mid-State Fair. He exemplifies the ethos of happiness through his love of sustainable farming + dazzling his winery guests in the garden with his fine wines. 

As one visitor noted, "Our pourer was actually the owner + winemaker Paul who regaled us with stories about their winery as well as Paso in general. It is not often you find the owner/winemaker in the tasting room chatting + getting super excited talking about his wines + with no hint of condescension to folks who might not know much about wines.”(paraphrased)

His joy is contagious, you feel that he + his charming wife are living the dream, a model of sustainability, a bewitching source for high-quality fruit + the generous sharing of their award winning wines.

So now you know that you must visit this small, family owned + operated 60-acre vineyard + winery that will up your merriment + exhilarate your palate.

Open 7 days a week, 11-5pm, bring along a picnic to enjoy in their gardens with expansive views of vineyards below. 

BONUS: Get your live music tickets on their website which includes a glass of wine upon arrival ($10 club/ $20 non club).

July 24th, Sat–Five Parts Devil 5:30-7:30

Aug 7, Sat–Nataly Lola 5:30-7:30

Aug 11, Wed–Emily Smith 5:30-7:30

Aug 21, Sat–Local Vocals 5:30-7:30

Aug 25, Wed–Brian Jeffrey 5:30-7:30

Sept 4, Sat–Nataly Lola 5:30-7:30

Sept 8, Wed–Jill Knight 5:30-7:30

Sept 22, Wed–Kenny Taylor 5:30-7:30

Oct 2, Sat–Julie Beaver 5-7

Oct 6, Wed–Emily Smith 4:30-6:30

Oct 16, Sat–Dulcie Taylor *Harvest Fest 3-5

Nov 6, Sat–Bear Market Riot  4-6

Wine pick: 2017 EXPRESSIONS OF STILL WATERS
This luscious red blend boasts aromas of anise, candied red cherry + smoky white pepper. A light-medium bodied GSM, this wine has a wonderful balance between acid, fruit + tannin. 50% Grenache 32% Syrah 18% Mourvèdre

Cheers!!

node.text:
“People who wonder if the glass is half empty or half full, miss the point. The glass is refillable.” - Simon Sinek

“I drink wine to make other people more interesting” & “Wine is one of the most civilized things in the world and one of the most natural things of the world that has been brought to the greatest perfection, and it offers a greater range for enjoyment and appreciation than, possibly, any other purely sensory thing.” - Ernest Hemingway @ernest_hemingway_vineyards 

“I shall drink no wine before it’s time! OK, it’s time.” - Groucho Marx

“Wine is sunlight, held together by water.” - Galileo

“Wine represents to me sharing and good times and a celebration of life. It is always around happy occasions with family and friends and centered around joy. What better item to be involved in then something that represents all these wonderful things.” - Dan Aykroyd

Do you have any favorite quotes?

node.text:
“..it’s the new wineries, or newly revitalized ones, that have really caught my eye: outstanding among them are @Jadawinery . . .” — STEVE HEIMOFF, WEST COAST EDITOR OF WINE ENTHUSIAST MAGAZINE.

And speaking of “outstanding”, all of the best wines start in the vineyard, in fact beneath the surface. At @Jadawinery with their 65 acre estate vineyard + 11 varietals, their secret lies under the shallow topsoil of clay loam + massive deposits of calcareous shale + pockets of limestone. 

This challenging soil environment along with an ideal climate, reduces vigor in the vines + causes decreased berry size, more intense flavor, a complex underlying minerality + fine wines. Oh yah, bring on some opulent, hedonistic fruit bombs baby! 

Now YOU are in the know about this fab winery that is quickly developing a cult following with their highly sought-after, all-estate, limited production Rhônes & Bordeauxs. 

In fact @wineenthusiast + @vinousmedia has showered blockbuster kudos on @Jadawinery. They have received; over 54 “90/90+” wine ratings for its all-estate, limited-production Rhône + Bordeaux-style wines using 100% sustainably farmed using biodynamic practices.

Wine pick, 92 PTS - 2017 Hell’s Kitchen "A blend of 60% Syrah, 20% Grenache, 16% Graciano, 3% Viognier, and 1% Tannat, the 2017 Hell's Kitchen spent 16 months in 15% new French oak. It has a beautiful bouquet of black fruits, crushed violets, ground pepper, and licorice. These carry to a medium to full-bodied, opulent Syrah that's packed with sweet fruit and offers terrific purity, sweet tannins, and a great finish. Drink this hedonistic fruit bomb over the coming 7-8 years.
If this wine sells out you’ll be sorry…however the Jada team can recommend some others that will knock your socks off.

For mapping + directions Speedfind.com/JadaVineyard
